Header: Southeast Asia aware of plastic problem but ‘no action plan’ taken
Content: Thailand is one of the top producers of plastic waste in the world but environmentalists say there is regional awareness that there is a problem, but there is ‘no action plan’ in place to address the issue. A 2015 report published by the Ocean Conservancy at the McKinsey Center for Business and Environment suggested that Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand, and Vietnam are some of the top plastic waste producers given their rapidly growing economies. The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration said last month that 10 million residents used 80 million plastic bags per day, averaging eight bags a day for one person.
